intro: Corydalis petrophila, commonly known as the Sierra Lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California and Oregon. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Corydalis petrophila is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
